title: How to create a white label version of Service Management Automation
content:
You can configure Service Management Automation so that, instead of the out-of-the-box logo and the Service Management Automation product name, it displays a logo and name of your choice.

  1. Create and enable a custom theme.

    For more information, see Add a new theme.

  2. Adjust the following settings as required:

    White label parts Settings

    Only the Service Portal

    • Name

    • Logo

    Service Portal and Service Management

    • Name

    • Logo

    • Agent interface header label

    • Agent interface header logo

    Service Management

    • Agent interface header label

    • Agent interface header logo

    For more information about these settings, see the Header section of Service Portal display theme settings.

  3. To create a white label version of the Service Portal, do either of the following:

    • Make the custom theme as created and configured above, the default theme.

    • Use entitlement rules to set the appropriate audience for the custom theme as created and configured above.

      For more information, see Set the audience for a custom theme.

  4. To create a white label version of the non Service Portal parts of Service Management, make the custom theme as created and configured above, the default theme.

Related topics

  • Quick guide to customizing the Service Portal
  • How to configure Service Portal display theme settings
